website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for something that's easy to use, you've found you're smoker. This is truly a set-it-and-forget-it smoker.
pros: Excellent durability and works well with wood briquettes
We like the cold smoke option and the fact that it can hold a lot of meat
cons: A few units have had problems with the heating element

customer_reviews.title: Buy a smoker that is more reliable.
customer_reviews.text: After 1 year of use, the generator no longer advances the bisquettes automatically. After I received replacement parts it still didnt work and I had to manually advance them. Buy a smoker that is more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Another Customer

customer_reviews.title: WORST smoker I've owned - died 2nd use!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the WORST smoker I've owned. I was so excited to try a chip feeder but the junky thing died during the second use. It had sat in our garage for some time before we used it and unfortunately the return window had passed. We thought we'd try fixing it and purchased a new heating element but no luck. (It stopped heating up) Save yourself and but something else.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffytoodle

customer_reviews.title: Its good for a year. Worthless after
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and have owned for about 4 years. The pros is it does work well for about a year. Cons to many for this to be a good purchase. The seals have given out around the door. The hinge at the top holding the door has broken. So open it door falls off. Then the thing making it almost worthless the cost of briquettes keep going up no local stores carry them. Only outdoor centers such as Cabellas. You can deal with propping the door open and rigging the hinge. When using it is to expensive and a hassle i say go with a pellet smoker.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby G. Ballew III

customer_reviews.title: The smoker is advertises as a set and forget smoker ...
customer_reviews.text: The smoker is advertises as a set and forget smoker but there are a few issues. - The smoker costs a dollar an hour to run based on the pellet rate. - Ultimately, the smoker met its fate in a grease fire. Do not leave it unattended. I had a few flare ups in the past but basically the drip channels are not 100% efficient and any flame can cause the grease to ignite. Once ignited, it is hard to put out. It served me well for two years and probably 30 uses, but I'd probably look for something more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Kuchenbecker

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Works well enough, very convenient for maintaining your smoke without constantly feeding the fire manually. Heating element is sort of weak so if you really fill it with lots of meat it may take longer than you expect. Just allow extra time. Also does not regulate temperature well, so if you're a stickler for total control you may want a digital model. But I've done a bunch of briskets, chickens, butts, and briskets on this thing and nobody's complained that they were smoked at X degrees below the ideal temp or whatever. :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best smoker for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Bradley Smoker in 10+ years. We gave away the first one before a cross country move. Just had a nice Texas BBQ with smoked pork and brisket. Have smoked a lot of salmon over the years and turkey breasts every Thanksgiving. Everyone loves whatever we smoke. This smoker is easy to use and Bradley offers great recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Used three times and always had issues getting to temp. Third use and it went up in flames.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Gunn

customer_reviews.title: Works great ! We have use it for 2 years so far
customer_reviews.text: I waited for a couple years before making this review because I wanted to make sure how good it really is. We have not any problem with it at all, it does a wonder job on smoking ribs, briskets and butt roast. We even hung a turkey from the top rack and smoked it. Wonderful! The only complaint is that the bradly wood puck are expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Newman

customer_reviews.title: We bought this and only used it a couple times ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this and only used it a couple times within a year time frame and it broke. It does not advance the disks.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Not happy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas present for the family, however we just had time to actually use it and it only heated up to 150 and then stop running after 2 hours so I had to put the food in the oven to finish cooking! Not happy!
customer_reviews.author: P. Connell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent unit, but short-lived.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this smoker in April 2016. When it worked, it worked amazing. For about 2 years there wasn't a single thing I could think of that I wouldn't rave about. About a year ago, the door broke. You can't get a replacement door, and you can't fix it.so, I want to give this little guy 5 stars, but because of its short life span and not being able to fix or replace the door I took off two stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I've had mine going on 4 years and
customer_reviews.text: Excellent smoker for most everything you throw in there. Temp gauge on the door is very accurate. I opted for analog over digital because sooner or later, that board could crash. Less liability with analog controls. I paid $112. 4 years ago. Now they have more than doubled in price !
customer_reviews.author: Chandon

customer_reviews.title: Overall very happy
customer_reviews.text: Taste is great. Brickettes get very expensive. In super cold weather hard to get over 200 degrees. We bring meat in and finish in the oven. Overall happy with this. Was a gift for the holidays
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Vobornik

customer_reviews.title: Hands-free smoking
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. I love to smoke meat but I don't want to spend all my time doing it. This is great for smoking while I can do lots of other things
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Good Product but after a few uses, it might burn down your house
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item on Aug 10, 2016 and today August 26 2017 the smoker caught fire. I've smoked maybe 7 times in the year that I've had this product. I would email the manufacturer but they only give a limited one year warranty. Prior to the fire I had no problems I'm just glad I was home to notice all the smoke before it burned down my house.
customer_reviews.author: wondercoolguy

customer_reviews.title: Good product, with a couple flaws.
customer_reviews.text: All the reviews about not getting over 150 are because the connector from the smoker to the main heating unit sucks. Bend the pins a touch, problem solved. It’s a bad connector design but easily fixed. Aside from that, it’s great. Also worth noting the temp control is a rheostat, not a thermostat. Crank it all the way up to preheat.
customer_reviews.author: Carl F

customer_reviews.title: a must have
customer_reviews.text: dont foget the accessories like recipe books and flavour "biscuits " to smoke with..
customer_reviews.author: Mommie Dearest

customer_reviews.title: wonderful smoker
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd Bradley smoker I have purchased. The first lasted 8 years and I used it on a weekly basis. The second was a gift. The 3rd I am currently still using. It works great! Just clean the seals and use a cover.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: It is basically a mini fridge converted into a smoker which would’ve been cool. The problem was that I could not get ...
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping this would have worked since the price was right! It is basically a mini fridge converted into a smoker which would’ve been cool. The problem was that I could not get the temperature to go over 150 degrees. After 12 hours of trying and minding the bisquettes I had to finish the brisket in the oven for 6 more hours. So disappointing. I wish they would make a version with a stronger heating element.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer A.

customer_reviews.title: So far I have overcooked two briskets but my third one was the best. The overcooking was more my fault than then ...
customer_reviews.text: My first smoker. I can't compare to the other brands or other smokers, but I did extensive reviews and purchased this one a few months ago. So far I have overcooked two briskets but my third one was the best. The overcooking was more my fault than then smokers, but you need to purchase some cheap stuff and learn your smoker before you go for the gusto. Very pleased with the product and I have not experienced any issues as noted from others. Gets up to temp as expected, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: B. BAUER

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: We just got back from our camping trip and I wanted to review my Bradley Smoker. For this being our very first time using it, let me tell you, it was not a let down. I smoked a brisket and chicken leg quarters. We started to smoke at 10:00 a.m. and left our cabin to explore nature and do several activities. By the time we made it back around 3, we checked and the meat looked beautiful, still had about an hour to go. Well worth every penny, you just place it in the smoker and walk away.......great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Diaz

customer_reviews.title: I totally love my smoker
customer_reviews.text: I totally love my smoker. It is so easy to use. My Big Green Egg does not get used much since I got the smoker. And don't waste your money getting the Expert Assembly. I am 70 years old and I put it together myself in no time at all.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara S.

customer_reviews.title: Good for week-end smokers
customer_reviews.text: Very good compact smoker. I have, so far, used it for: ribs, salmon, trout, chicken and cheese. Good for temperatures up to 225-250 degrees which suits most projects. The smoker is a little small if you want to try out larger cuts of meat. The wood bisquettes comes in most flavors, but are quite expensive. Also, unless buying them online, they are hard to come by as only a few places sells them. The 20 min burn time for each 'puck' is pretty accurate. The water bowl is a little small but can easily be replaced by larger steel bowl of same depth.
customer_reviews.author: I enjoy good wine

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!!!!
customer_reviews.text: 6 racks of babybacks at a time and I did 18. No worry, consistent heat, smoke and temperature. I don't even want to look at another bucket of chips soaking, chip box, flames and ashes again in life!!
customer_reviews.author: Chefpms

customer_reviews.title: Good smoker, included recipe book is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Take my advice, and throw away the recipe book that comes with this. The temps are wrong (too low), as are the cooking times. I talked to Bradley about this, and the guy there told me they don't really check those recipes, that they are user submitted. Not really a good idea to print without checking those. The boneless turkey breast? Wrong from the beginning to the end. Don't use the book.
customer_reviews.author: S. Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Flawless so far
customer_reviews.text: No complaints. It works as anticipated, no fire issues, everything loads normally. I was paranoid about the loading so I watch it pretty frequently but have yet to have it not work. Holds smoke well. I mostly use it to smoke before Sous Vide so I work with lower temps than normal but I haven't had any trouble maintaining these temperatures or getting it up to them.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: FIRE DANGER!!!
customer_reviews.text: The whole thing went up. The water bowl exploded causing a fire. PLEASE DO NOT BUY. I called them to let them know there was a fire danger, They told me NOTHING WAS WRONG!!!! Thank God I was watching it closely, The fire started so quickly and was intense. I wanted to love it, I really wanted to be positive.
customer_reviews.author: Ian K.

customer_reviews.title: It will do in a pinch, but it isn't my favorite smoker
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it is a pretty good smoker. I dislike the automatic smoke generator. It would be nicer to have some control on how much smoke is generated. Most of the time, the smoke is too much. I always have the option of removing the wood discs and just using it as a slow cooker, but once there aren't enough discs to push another one onto the heater, it ends up half burning the next one which ends up wasting that wood disc. If the discs were cheaper then that would not be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Meganp1721

customer_reviews.title: Caught on FIRE!
customer_reviews.text: Was smoking a pork butt this morning. After an hour, went out to check on it. Smoke was pouring out of the top and when I opened the door FLAMES burst out at me! Melted all of the rubber on the doors and plastic inside. It’s not my first time using this smoker, have cooked 3 nice pork butts and it has been kept indoors between uses. Can not believe an electric smoker could be that dangerous!
customer_reviews.author: Burdette Park

customer_reviews.title: Please,answere me
customer_reviews.text: I use this smoker twice and the heat element is bad and don't work already. Send me a new,element no charge so I don't have to post everywhere how bad this unit is. Just ruined and big piece of meat because of it ty.. my email is jameshansel5@gmail.com
customer_reviews.author: James Hansel

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is a great smoker. It is very well insulated and has enough room for most backyard BBQers. I would suggest that you get a good thermometer as mine was showing about 20 to 25 degrees too low. Luckily I use a dual input thermometer and go by its temperature. Also another good purchase would be the Bubba pucks. They save on your bisquettes.
customer_reviews.author: Whitesnake

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: It showed up broken and I returned it. Very cheap don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Mooer

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker!
customer_reviews.text: This smoker does a great job of adding sufficient smoke flavor to meats. It is easy to use, it maintains temperature very well, except when you open the door. I suggest anyone who buys this to purchase a rectangular pan for the water in the bottom. The little round bowl doesn't hold enough water to last through a 6 hour smoking. I added some vinegar and apple juice to the water also for more flavor. Otherwise, a great smoker.
customer_reviews.author: James E VanDyke

customer_reviews.title: Best smoker that I have ever owned, buy one.
customer_reviews.text: The pucks are easy to use and you use less than you think. The pucks add flavor so if your worried about needing a ton... just smoke at the end of your cook, the heat works just fine without them too. I love the smoker for smaller Briskets. I smoke a lot of jerky too but I dehydrated the meat first then smoke for and hour or three and it tastes fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Heating element burned out.
customer_reviews.text: Used it 4 times before winter came, had it covered over the winter, and when I turned it on in spring, the heating element didn't work. $22 for a new one, which isn't bad as long as this was just a bit of bad luck and doesn't happen again.
customer_reviews.author: Benn

customer_reviews.title: Not your average smoker
customer_reviews.text: After many years of purchasing "Other" brands of smokers, I finally decided to get a Bradley. All I can say is "Why did I wait so long?" I put it to use last weekend for the first time and the German sausage I made turned out amazing. If there was one design change I could make, I would like to see some handles incorporated into it.
customer_reviews.author: walla2k5

customer_reviews.title: OMG was it ever good!!
customer_reviews.text: Been wanting to purchase this for 2 years.....finally pulled the trigger. Yesterday I used it for the first time....smoked a pork butt.....OMG was it ever good!!! Can't wait to do chicken, ribs, salmon and maybe even a turkey. I'm so happy....just wish I hadn't waited so long.....Gonna have to increase my workouts or I'm gonna get fat eating all the good foods in my future.......worth it....:))
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Awesome smoker. Works very well
customer_reviews.text: Awesome smoker. Works very well. Have done salmon and duck so far, both turned out great. Something to consider is the number of bisquettes used during the smoking process. The Bisquettes provide A LOT of smoke, so smoking during the entire cooking process might be a bit much.
customer_reviews.author: IanM

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect it to last long
customer_reviews.text: The wood biscuit feeder stopped feeding after three weeks. Now the oven struggles to reach 200 deg F. When it worked properly, the foods were wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: PHDJLP

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: Worked great about a year then it burnt out the heating element over and over now the wiring burnt up needs to be desired trash but another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Used 5 times now and works awesome. It's hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: Used 5 times now and works awesome. It's hard to clean, but we use Pam on it now and makes things easier. We use 2 hours of chips and has the same taste using them throughout the cooking time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but unexpected issues
customer_reviews.text: Smokes ok over 25 degrees, well over 40 degrees. I didn't realize bisquettes you need are so expensive and they don't always advance without manual help. We have bought cheaper chips and just manually put them in but it's a pain. On other hand, unit looks nice, cover keeps it inconspicuous on porch and we use it a lot for salmon, scallops, chicken and pork loin. Seems to cook faster than many recipes say it will take.
customer_reviews.author: Cris

customer_reviews.title: Door fell off after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I don't like to leave a review till after I use it a few times. Its been 4 months and my door has fallen off. I called and they will replace it but I was told that it happens because the damper was closed. I am not sure how true that is but oh well. I do not think it holds a candle to actual firewood smoking in a pit but that is my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great at first then went downhill in a hurry
customer_reviews.text: Only lasted a couple years before completely falling apart.. had to fight with the biscuit feeder and heat every step of the way. Now the front door fell off. This thing's always been put away in the shed and well taken care of. I would look at something or anything else to be honest.
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Best smoker I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: It took my husband and I several tries until we figured it out but now that we did we love it. If you go to Bradley's forums you can get some really good advice and tips. We now make the best ribs we have ever eaten in our lives and it cooks steaks,chicken, and tri-tips just as good. It's so easy to clean up and pretty easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: River13

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little smoker for someone who is wanting to get ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little smoker for someone who is wanting to get into smoking food. It seems to be pretty well constructed, and the auto feed tube keeps you from constantly having to put in wood chips or chunks. The only real issue I have with the smoker is on cooler days it was hard to get the temperature up to where it needed to be. It would only get up to right about 200.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Mine didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I can kind of see some potential with this thing but I don’t really know since mine came with a heating element that wouldn’t get hot unless I bypassed the thermostat. Wish I could fix the issue so I could try it out
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Original Bradley Smoker not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Setting the cooking temperature is almost impossible. It took over a half hour and then it wasn't stable. They recommend using a meat thermometer but that only tells you the temp inside the meat not the temp inside the smoker. I would never recommend this smoker and am extremely angry with myself for purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Medchill

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long to start smoking...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a few weeks ago and immediately added an Auber PID single probe kit for better temp control. There was a bit of a learning curve involved but now the smoker is cranking out delicious and perfectly cooked beef brisket and boston butt. Use a decent digital thermometer to monitor internal temp of the meat and let you know when it's done. The Bradley smoker is turning out to be one of the better purchases I've made in a while.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: I bought this analog model and was shipped the didgital ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this analog model and was shipped the didgital model and it bit the dirt 3 times falling , Bradley sent replacement parts but now it's out of warranty and its broke again .
customer_reviews.author: Richard Koeder

customer_reviews.title: Garbage didn’t arrive as specified
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived without necessary parts. It is missing the smoke tray as well as the wheels
customer_reviews.author: Darcy

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with the quality
customer_reviews.text: This is the first smoker I have ever used, but it is so simple to use. It started to smoke and get up to 225 degrees fairly quickly. It flavors the food so completely. I am very happy with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: J. E. Hedquist

customer_reviews.title: cant get temp over 175 degrees, tried replacing the ...
customer_reviews.text: cant get temp over 175 degrees, tried replacing the heating element and same results. Not sure what the issue is, but disappointing non the less
customer_reviews.author: E. Mastin

customer_reviews.title: Good smoke, but doesn't advance automatically
customer_reviews.text: Makes great food (AMAZING FLAVOR), but the bisquettes do not advance automatically. You have to push the button every 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie W.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 Seasons
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 2 seasons, Pucks are expensive. Shelves are a bit small. Long recovery time when opening door.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl

customer_reviews.title: Don't need to buy the cold smoke adapter
customer_reviews.text: Got this out of the box, seasoned and smoking our first batch of sausage. It's really easy to adjust the temperature, the outside of the box stays cool. It can cold smoke as it is, you don't have to buy the cold smoke adapter, just unplug the tower from the generator. I wish they sold bigger boxes of bisquettes.
customer_reviews.author: Jody D.

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My husband has used it for fish. I've used for chicken, and I'm planning a turkey next!
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't get hot enough
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed could not get temperature to exceed 120 degrees it's okay if you do in jerky and you want to do it for over 24 hours but if you do any large piece of meat were internal temperature needs to get hotter it's never going to happen when the temperature in the Box only gets to 120 at the highest little bit too flashy with the front door insignia of smoke could have been a little more subtle I did like the selfie briquette feature
customer_reviews.author: Holly J. Palmeri

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker
customer_reviews.text: This is my first smoker and I found this to be an excellent starter smoker. The ease of use was simple. From my first project to current, all my food came out perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Daphne Cramer

customer_reviews.title: Caught on fire
customer_reviews.text: Received smoker yesterday , used it today for the first time. Checked it every 45 minutes, 5 hours into smoking It caught on fire.
customer_reviews.author: charles d clifton

customer_reviews.title: The feed tray is very easy to use and the heat/smoke gives all meats an ...
customer_reviews.text: This smoker was a gift for my dad and he loves it. The feed tray is very easy to use and the heat/smoke gives all meats an excellent aroma and flavor. The best thing about this smoker is that you can "set and forget" for hours and just let the aromas call you back. Plenty big with four racks for all the favorites!
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Carson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for a few times. Only works well in summer. Not good in Spring and Autumn.
customer_reviews.author: B. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Good pick
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves his new smoker. Small, compact but multiple racks. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This products temp control did not work!!! I kept it on its own circuit and even called Bradley for advice. This product is FAULTY!!!!! Bradley will NOT stand behind their product when its under warranty. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker, struggles a bit when it's cold outside.
customer_reviews.text: Works great and I like the automatic feeding. Of course you need to buy the Bradley wood, but I feel it's worth it. It does struggle to stay hot enough in the cold - I used it once in 4 degrees with some wind and I had to position a table to block the wind.
customer_reviews.author: P. P.

customer_reviews.title: Faulty wiring in Bradley Smoker
customer_reviews.text: Unit wouldn't heat up, thought heating element went because that is the most common complaint. Ordered new heating element replaced still didn't work. Took back off the unit and found wire fried and broken. Glad my house didn't burn down!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: We found great suggestions on several Bradley Smoker websites
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves his new smoker. It is the original model which I was advised to buy. There are a few things a beginner needs to know for successful smoking. We found great suggestions on several Bradley Smoker websites. We have smoked delicious pork ribs and even a prime rib on this smoker.
customer_reviews.author: L.C.

customer_reviews.title: Withholding judgment as of now
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine the first three times, but recently we could not get it up to temperature
customer_reviews.author: tiptoes

customer_reviews.title: ) Solid built and very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical about the purchase after some folks spoke about difficulty bringing up the temperature, but I have used this a few times now and am finding it tough to keep it below 240 or so :) Solid built and very happy with the purchase. Having to always put in 3 additional bisquettes is slightly annoying (to push the other ones through) and I cannot find the aluminium "pucks" anymore to do this, but in all, very happy I got this smoker!
customer_reviews.author: J Shea

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought this smoker a long time ago.
customer_reviews.text: We've become "smoking fools". I've smoked salmon, chicken wings, a whole chicken, a boston butt, baked beans and all turned out great! My only regret is that I didn't buy the smoker sooner. It is a lot easier than my Big Green Egg.
customer_reviews.author: Dena

customer_reviews.title: Smoke while you sleep!
customer_reviews.text: This smoker is fabulous. I've done pork shoulders, whole loins, briskets, chicken, shrimp, meatloafs, meat balls to the raves of my guests. When I have to replace it the only change I'd make is I'd go digital. That being said I really love this smoker...it allows me to smoke over night and add wood while I'm fast asleep.
customer_reviews.author: Media Man

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Bradley smoker, the first finally going belly-up after many, many years and it worked fine. This one has improvements that are much appreciated. Have made jerky and smoked salmon several times. Have also smoked a whole chicken which also turned out great.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Crager

customer_reviews.title: D'oh!!!  Smoked meaty goodness
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box follow directions get a good cut of meat and a nice rub and you will be making great smoked meats. Plenty of wood flavors to choose from. Quality made product. I am very happy with my Father's Day gift.
customer_reviews.author: Homer Jay

customer_reviews.title: No heat....
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a good review writer- I just usually forget. We've had this smoker for only 1 year and now it won't heat up, although the smoke generator works good still. Of course, you don't figure this out until you put meat in it that won't cook. I would have expected more than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this smoker!! I use it all the time and the smoke flavor and eveness is great!
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Helveston

customer_reviews.title: It seems like many of the critical failures of older models have ...
customer_reviews.text: It seems like many of the critical failures of older models have been addressed. The heat setting is now on a knob on the puck holder and away from the front where juices kept running out and screwing up the electronics. Vastly improved interior. Just a much better unit. You have to wonder why it takes so many failures of a model to get the design engineers attention.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Hurst

customer_reviews.title: I've had this over 2 years now and I love it. I've done pork butts
customer_reviews.text: I've had this over 2 years now and I love it. I've done pork butts, briskets, chickens, ribs, sausages, meat loaf (yes, meat loaf)...and the list goes on and on. I have personally messed up a few of those, but the Bradley has been rock solid. One word of warning...you will not be able to maintain a consistent temperature without the Auberins PID. You'll find that mentioned in other reviews. It's an absolute necessity.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Jones

customer_reviews.title: It’s not worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Only had smoker since May of 2018 it’s broke we only used it like 5 times! For $270 really? Can’t get a hold of anyone to see about getting it fixed.

customer_reviews.title: Nothing is better.
customer_reviews.text: I have never smoked or even owned a smoker before this one and now I am HOOKED! It may not be an "approved" smoker by the professionals as all you have to do is set it and almost forget about it. With it being electric and having a auto feeder you just have to learn the temperature gauge as it does NOT have the degree setting. It goes from low to high. I have already smoked ribs, pork shoulder, brisket and corn! Nothing is better.

I take it camping with me, it is easy to take apart and put back together. I ordered the package deal and I was very happy with the price and time it took to get here. One very happy camper.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Amazon was great, prime shipping was great! The assembly took less than ten minutes without instructions. The smoker arrived in perfect condition. Smoke flavor was better than expected since I am accustomed to smoking over wood! Excellent product for the cost!

product_meta.title: Bradley Smoker BS611 Electric Smoker, One Size, Black
product_meta.description: For years now, Bradley has created world-class smokers, and the original is the food smoker that changed the game! The Bradley Original Smoker has lasted the test of time. Our easy-to-use, world-class food smokers consistently deliver results. The unique, automatic feed system enables you to load up your smoker with nine hours of Bradley Flavor Bisquettes. No Ash! Wood bisquettes extinguish before they turn to foul-tasting ash. Get Bradley’s delicious and clean smoke. With two separately controlled heat elements (one for the oven, one to create smoke) your smoker can now function as a hot smoker, cold smoker, oven, or dehydrator. The generator has a removable side panel for ease of cleaning and preventative maintenance to keep your smoker lasting longer. The fully insulated stainless steel interior and magnetic door make for easy cleanup and keeps the smoke where it’s supposed to be.
feature_bullets: Rack supports keep racks from tipping over when pulled out
Heat control moved to smoke generator which will eliminate moisture damage to switch
Inside dimensions-19 inch above drip tray
